CatDescriptText: Mrs. Geneva Peay, clerk, 2544 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Federal Government should provide financial aid for students of exceptional ability to further their education when the students are unable to do so for themselves?" answer reads: "Yes, we are living in an atomic age where more scientists and learned students are greatly needed."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Geneva Peay wearing coat with shawl collar, dark gloves, and oval and stripe patterned scarf, posed in front of flecked granite wall
